docs.text: EpiJS Docs ¶ Welcome to the EpiJS Documentation! Installation ¶ 1 npm install epijs Or, use it in your website: 1 2 < script src = "https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/quantalabs/epijs@1.0.0/web/pre.min.js" ></ script > < script src = "https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/chart.js@3.0.2/dist/chart.min.js" > <!-- Chart . js is required . --> Usage ¶ 1 const epijs = require ( "@quantalabs/epijs" ) See the docs for more! Run tests ¶ 1 2 3 git clone https://github.com/Quantalabs/epijs.git npm install npm test Modules ¶ In v1, EpiJS currently only has the pre module. See the docs for it here
docs.title: EpiJS Docs

docs.title: Modules

docs.text: Getting Started ¶ Getting started with EpiJS Install ¶ 1 npm install epijs Or use it in your webpage: 1 2 < script src = "https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/Quantalabs/EpiJS/web/pre.min.js" ></ script > < script src = "https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/chart.js@3.0.2/dist/chart.min.js" > <!-- Chart . js is required . --> You can check your installation with: 1 console . log ( epijs . about ) You should get a bunch of metadata as the output. The Pre Module ¶ This is the only module EpiJs has currently, and you can use pre-compiled models to generate graphs and charts. To check out the functions, see the pre docs here
docs.title: Getting Started

docs.text: Getting started with EpiJS
docs.title: Getting Started

docs.text: 1 npm install epijs Or use it in your webpage: 1 2 < script src = "https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/Quantalabs/EpiJS/web/pre.min.js" ></ script > < script src = "https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/chart.js@3.0.2/dist/chart.min.js" > <!-- Chart . js is required . --> You can check your installation with: 1 console . log ( epijs . about ) You should get a bunch of metadata as the output.
docs.title: Install

docs.text: This is the only module EpiJs has currently, and you can use pre-compiled models to generate graphs and charts. To check out the functions, see the pre docs here
docs.title: The Pre Module

docs.text: Table of Contents ¶ sir Parameters Examples seir Parameters Examples seird Parameters Examples seihrd Parameters Examples Pre ¶ Pre-made graphs for modelling outbreaks. sir ¶ The SIR Model returns a chart.js graph with the total Susceptible, Infected, and Recovered after the given amount of time. Parameters ¶ c HTMLElement The HTML5 Canvas Element. rn Number R Naught, or the amount of people one infected infects whlie infected. s Number The Susceptible population at the beggining of the outbreak i Number The Infected population at the beggining of th outbreak time Number The time the total simulation lasts. u Number The recovery rate p Number The total population. Examples ¶ sir ( sirchart , 4 , 9999 , 1 , 100 , 1 / 21 , 10000 ) seir ¶ The SIR Model returns a chart.js graph with the total Susceptible, Exposed, Infected, and Recovered after the given amount of time. Parameters ¶ c HTMLElement The HTML5 Canvas Element. rn Number R Naught, or the amount of people one infected infects whlie infected. s Number The Susceptible population at the beggining of the outbreak i Number The Infected population at the beggining of th outbreak t Number The time the total simulation lasts. u Number The recovery rate a Number The incubation period p Number The total population. Examples ¶ seir ( seirchart , 4 , 9999 , 1 , 100 , 1 / 7 , 1 / 7 , 10000 ) seird ¶ The SIR Model returns a chart.js graph with the total Susceptible, Exposed, Infected, Recovered, and Dead populations after the given amount of time. Parameters ¶ c HTMLElement The HTML5 Canvas Element. rn Number R Naught, or the amount of people one infected infects whlie infected. s Number The Susceptible population at the beggining of the outbreak i Number The Infected population at the beggining of the outbreak t Number The time the total simulation lasts. u Number The recovery rate a Number The incubation period d Number The death rate p Number The total population. Examples ¶ seird ( seirdchart , 4 , 99999 , 1 , 100 , 1 / 21 , 1 / 14 , 1 / 100 , 10000 ) seihrd ¶ The SIR Model returns a chart.js graph with the total Susceptible, Exposed, Infected, Recovered, and Dead populations after the given amount of time. Parameters ¶ c HTMLElement The HTML5 Canvas Element. rn Number R Naught, or the amount of people one infected infects whlie infected. s Number The Susceptible population at the beggining of the outbreak i Number The Infected population at the beggining of the outbreak t Number The time the total simulation lasts. u Number The recovery rate for the infected population uh Number The recovery rate for the hospitalized population a Number The incubation period di Number The death rate for the infected population dh Number The death rate for the hospitalized population h Number The hospitalization rate p Number The total population. Examples ¶ seird ( seirdchart , 4 , 99999 , 1 , 100 , 1 / 21 , 1 / 14 , 1 / 100 , 10000 )
docs.title: Pre
